result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Motion hearing on November 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:21 AM Defendant Shon Lamont Nichols appeared by video.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Shon Lamont Nichols.  Attorney Robert J Jambois in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Jambois calls the case and states the appearances.

Atty Soule states that this will be set for a jury trial.
Court explains that Mr. Nichols has the right to have a private conversation with his attorney at any point today during this hearing.

State will need time to file another axe motion in this case.

State is in compliance with victims right legislation.
There is no victim present to make a statement.

Substantive motions to be addressed on November 10th. 
Motions in limine, jury instructions, and witness lists to be filed by October 28th.
Substantive motions to be filed by October 21st.

All of discovery has gone out in this case.
Court wants notification from each party by October 14th regarding discovery.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Exhibit #P1 Copy of Criminal Complaint

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

4:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew Mutchler appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shon Lamont Nichols appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Taylor O Soule for Shon Lamont Nichols appeared in court. 

Court questions defendant and informs of the right to be present in the courtroom.
Defendant requests to appear remotely and confirms that he/she can hear. 
Defendant understands that if there are hearing problems to let the court know.
Defendant indicates he/she understands the right to be present in the courtroom and has discussed with his/her attorney.

Officer S. Roarke is called and sworn. 
Direct exam by Atty Mutchler. 
Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the plaintiff and referred to during testimony. 
Atty Mutchler moves for the admission of Exhibit #1. 
Court questions the witness. 
Atty Soule does not object to the admission of Exhibit #1 and begins cross examination. 
Re-direct exam by Atty Mutchler. 

BY THE COURT: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.

3:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shon Lamont Nichols appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Taylor O Soule appeared in court for Shon Lamont Nichols.  ADA Jambois informs the Court they are not able to proceed as his witness didn't get his subpoena.  No objections. Matter is rescheduled.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:28 PM Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court. Defendant Shon Lamont Nichols not in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Andrew Mutchler appeared for State of Wisconsin.

Atty Bergner has not additional information for the court. 
Atty Mutchler requests a warrant.  Notice was sent for today's hearing to the defendant's last known address. 
Court reviews the complaint. 
Court indicates the defendant has not posted the cash bond. 
Atty Mutchler will recall the case once they have been able to locate the defendant. 
1:32 p.m.  Court takes a brief recess.
1:33 p.m.  Defendant Shon Lamont Nichols now appears by video from the Portage County jail. 
  
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Court questions Atty Mutchler if the states is relying on felony or misdemeanors for repeaters. 
Atty Mutchler indicates misdemeanors. 
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney Bergner requests a preliminary hearing to be held within the time limits.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
filed by Atty Taylor Soule
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Taylor Soule
Initial Appearance set for February 21, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

No contact with the victim J.P.
May go to the premises one time, accompanied by law enforcement, to retrieve personal belongings.
Do not possess any dangerous weapons.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelley Cassidy  appears in court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video. 
Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner appears in court for defendant. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Battery-Domestic, Intimation, Use of Dangerous Weapon, False Imprisonment, and Threats to Injure. 
Atty Bergner  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
State requests a bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Bergner states objections as to bond. 

BY THE COURT: Court sets bond
